fields.name: Carrie McMeel
fields.bio:
5 years qualified, commercial, data protection and regulatory solicitor. Carrie regularly advises dog rescues in relation
to legal issues as they arise for them. She has also extensively advised and drafted policies, agreements and
procedures for dog rescues. Carrie gives countless hours of volunteering at her local rescue, Dogs Aid and is the
proud owner of her two gorgeous rescue dogs; Dots (Collon) & Zag (Dogs Aid).

fields.name: Demi Mullen
fields.bio:
6 years qualified, investment funds solicitor. Demi co-established the Animal Law Network Ireland along with a
colleague in 2024 - a group for legal professionals and academics with an interest in animal law in Ireland. Demi has
presented on dog law in Ireland at the UK Centre for Animal Law Conference and Causeway Coast Dog Rescue’s
Companion Animal Welfare Conference. Demi adopted her gorgeous furbaby Klaus from Cara Rescue in February
2019.

fields.name: Hannah Unger
fields.bio: 6 years qualified, public and regulatory law solicitor with Fieldfisher Ireland LLP. Along with her day to day work, she leads a pro bono team focused on reviewing dog laws and proposing reforms. In May 2024, Hannah published a report titled 'Key Reforms to Dog Breeding in Ireland' which she presented at Leinster House. In addition, she regularly shares her expertise in the media, contributing to both print and radio discussions on dog breeding reforms. Hannah also advises dog rescues in relation to legal issues as they arise for them and has assisted in drafting their policies and procedures. In addition, she advises private clients in relation to the Control of Dogs Act 1986 (as amended).

fields.name: Sashay for Strays
fields.tagline:
Fundraiser on 20 June 2025 with drag music bingo, karaoke & DJs in Street 66 on Parliament Street, Dublin 2 (dog friendly bar):

Tickets are 20euro and all proceeds will be split between 
DOGS ANGELS IRELAND
WICKLOW ANIMAL WELFARE
THE HAVEN RESCUE
WORKING ANIMAL GUARDIANS
fields.description:
Dog Law Ireland and the Irish Dog Father are delighted to announce “SASHAY FOR STRAYS” taking place on 20 June 2025 in aid of four amazing dog rescues:

DOGS ANGELS IRELAND,
WICKLOW ANIMAL WELFARE,
THE HAVEN RESCUE,
WORKING ANIMAL GUARDIANS. 

Tickets are 20euro and available on Eventbrite.ie

fields.name: Santa Paws
fields.tagline: Dog Law Ireland held a Santa Paws event on 23 November 2024 in aid of Dogs Angels Ireland and the Haven Rescue and raised an incredible €7,200.
fields.description: Dog owners were able to get a photo with Santa Paws and their dog and also attend a gorgeous Christmas market!

fields.name: Raise the Woof
fields.tagline:
FUNDRAISER FOR DOGS ANGELS IRELAND & WICKLOW ANIMAL WELFARE. Friday, 17 November 2023 in the Lighthouse pub in Dun Laoghaire.

Raised €6,748 for Dogs Angels and Wicklow Animal Welfare.
fields.description:
• Dublin Ukelele Collective

• Raffle / Speeches

• Conor Dunne DJ

• Bella Festa DJs

Tickets €15 each and all proceeds donated to Dogs Angels and Wicklow Animal Welfare.

fields.name: Padel, Pups, Pints
fields.tagline:
07 September 2024 in Fitzpatrick Hotel, Killiney - fundraiser for Dogs Angels Ireland & Wicklow Animal Welfare - padel, yoga, hanging out with adorable pups, & enjoying some cold pints with friends!

Raised €6,815 for Dogs Angels Ireland & Wicklow Animal Welfare

fields.name: Hannah Unger: Ireland is the puppy farm capital of Europe – these few simple changes could solve that
fields.description:
On 18 December 2023, Hannah Unger published an Op-ed in the Irish Independent newspaper. 

https://www.independent.ie/opinion/comment/hannah-unger-ireland-is-the-puppy-farm-capital-of-europe-these-few-simple-changes-could-solve-that/a921229125.html

fields.name: Fieldfisher - Key Reforms to Dog Breeding in Ireland
fields.description: In May 2024, Hannah Unger (one of the founders of Dog Law Ireland) published a report titled, Key Reforms to Dog Breeding in Ireland | Fieldfisher, which she presented at Leinster House. The paper contains a roadmap for change when it comes to dog breeding in Ireland including: Establishment of a more appropriate staff to dog ratio, changes to the scope of 2010 Act to bring more breeders under its remit, change in the age of breeding bitches, reduction in the number of litters a breeding bitch can whelp and in what time period, etc.
fields.tagline: In May 2024, Hannah Unger (one of the founders of Dog Law Ireland) published...

fields.name: Hannah Unger gives interview with Jennifer Zamparelli on RTE 2FM
fields.description: On 24 February 2024, Hannah gave an interview on 2FM in relation to Ireland's dog crisis and suggested dog breeding reforms.
fields.tagline: On 24 February 2024, Hannah gave an interview on 2FM...

fields.name: Second open Letter to Minister Calleary: Concerns re the Control of Dogs (XL Bully) Regulations 2024
fields.description: On 12 February 2025, Dog Law Ireland submitted an open letter to Minister Calleary in relation to the shortfalls relating to the XL Bully Regulations
fields.tagline: Second open letter sent to Minister Callerary

fields.name: First open letter to Minister Humphreys titled 'reconsideration of the XL Bully Type ban'
fields.description: In September 2024, Dog Law Ireland wrote their first open letter to the former Minister for Rural Community and Development to ask her to reconsider implementing the XL Bully Type ban by setting out alternatives which would greater enhance public safety.
fields.tagline: First open letter to Minister Humphreys titled 'reconsideration of the XL Bully Type ban'
